ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned that writing is a process and should be treated as such. I also learned about the They Say/I Say structure for an argument.

This course was a phenomenal introduction to college essay writing. After the course, I feel prepared to tackle a great number of writing assignments ranging from an academic research paper to a creative writing essay. Professor Klemann's does an amazing job breaking down the essay process into obtainable steps. At the conclusion of the class I produced a research paper which I both enjoyed and was extremely proud of. Overall, I highly recommend Professor Klemann and this course.
I learned how to use footnotes appropriately and revise for concision.
I learned how to write at a higher level and how to approach longer papers and more academic style writing.
I have significantly improved my writing skills

I improved my ability to develop a thesis, support arguments with research and evidence, portray the complexities and nuances of arguments, and write with proper structure and language. I also loved diving into the topics of entrepreneurship and artificial intelligence -- our discussions about AI ethics were truly riveting!

The biggest game-changer for writing that I have learned through this course was to learn how to talk to others about my topic and thesis to develop them further. Toward the end of the semester with the P3 and P4, I heavily discussed my topic with my suitemates and professor as well as unassociated people who were interested in my topic, and it enormously helped me with aligning my thoughts and formulating my essay. I also learned that the thesis should not be easy to think of and requires time to develop. In essays before, I would write a generic thesis and expand on my arguments during the body paragraph resulting in a weak thesis with a load of evidence pointing to many mini-arguments. Upon working on the various essays, I learned to take time with the thesis, and everything will align afterward; the thesis is the make or break of the paper not necessarily the evidence brought.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the topics of AI, entrepreneurship, and ethics. I particularly enjoyed the case studies we covered at the end of the semester. It would be great if more of these case studies could be sprinkled throughout earlier in the semester.

The strengths of this course are the accessibility to the professor and the guidance which is provided throughout every step of the writing process. 
There were no noticeable negatives of the course.
Course was a bit slow and strayed at times from the themes.
It has a lot of content for writing which is good, nothing really to be improved
This course was all around a masterclass.

I very much enjoyed the variety of sources used in the course from Sci-Fi movies like Ex Machina to in-depth academic journal articles and case studies. It gave me a wide range of knowledge on the topic and taught me how to analyze these different sources and how to write essays on them. I think the course was well-structured, and the material was presented well, so there is nothing, in particular, I would change.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Professor Klemann is engaging and provides very helpful feedback on our writing assignments. She truly wishes for us to improve as writers and puts in effort both in and out of the classroom (during Office Hours) to achieve this goal.

I would highly recommend this course to any other student. It is a great introductory class to allow you to feel comfortable writing a college essay. Professor Klemann is amazing and does a great job pushing every single student to produce their best work and challenges students to push their intellectual understanding.
Yes, it really helps build writing skills!
I would absolutely recommend this course, especially if taught by Professor Klemann. She made the experience great!

I would defintitely recommend this course to another student. It is a great introduction to college writing, and my writing has improved dramatically. I feel well prepared after this class to potentially pursue other writing courses.
